result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarel L Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs, disbursements and surcharges.  Payment should be made by monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amount in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED.  Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with the victim Latoya W. or codefendant Daejujuan Spivey.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tarel L Perkins in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Tarel L Perkins in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel still in negotiations and requested another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Tarel L Perkins not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
TOT to Justice Point: no alcohol or drugs; random testing; no firearms or weapons.  No Contact Order remains.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Tarel L Perkins not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.    Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court set bail at $1,000.00 cash.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference before Branch 20 on 4/14/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 03/03/2015 received and filed. mt

Defendant Tarel L Perkins in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Tarel L Perkins in custody.  Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Tracy Becker.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LATOYA W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tarel L Perkins in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Tarel L Perkins in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
